Germany: Gero, the margrave of the Marca Geronis, died. The march was divided into five: the Northern March, the Saxon Eastern March, the Margravate of Meissen, the March of Zeitz and the March of Merseburg.
Cyprus: Cyprus was restored to Byzantine rule by Nicepheros Phokas
China: The Later Shu emperor Meng Chang surrendered to the Song army at his capital Chengdu.
Belgium: Death of Arnulf I, Count of Flanders; succession of Arnulf II, Count of Flanders
Otto I, Holy Roman Emperor, confirms Godfrey of Lower Lotharingia's gift to Saint-Ghislain Abbey of 18 mansi of land in Villers-Saint-Ghislain.
Death of Bruno the Great, Duke of Lotharingia.
